chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K Traxler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentenced to 15 years in WI State Prison. 10 yrs initial confinement with 5 yrs Extended Supervision.
REPORT FORTHWITH

superMiscConds.notes: Comply and complete Sex Offender Treatment

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No possession of pornograthy

Provide DNA Sample;  Comply with sex offender registry; Comply with polygraph testing; Face to face contact with law enforcement.
pay restitution, court obligations and DOC supervision fees
PSI to be released to treatment provider.

supervisions.notes: AODA and any follow up treatment

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael K Traxler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael K Traxler in court with attorney Michele Tjader.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the PSI and are ready to proceed.  Court questions Atty Tjader.  Atty Tjader states that she has gone over the PSI with her client and there is no changes to be made.  
Court received phsyco sexual evaluation.  Atty Tjader states a change in that report.  
  State has complied with victim notification requirements. 
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Tjader states that full names were used in the victim impact statement and asks that those be blacked out.
BY THE COURT:  Court will order those names be blacked out before filing.

Atty Tjader makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement ot the court.

BY THE COURT:   Court orders 15 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 10 years being Initial Confinement and 5 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
*Report forthwith
*Credit = 0 days
*Court Costs = $268
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*Not eligible for Challange Incarceration Program
*Not eligible for Substance Abuse Program
*Payment of any restitution , court obligations and DOC supervision fees
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Comply with the Sex Offender Registry
*Comply and complete Sex Offender Treatment
*Release PSI to Treatment Provider
*Comply with polygraph testing
*Face to Face contact with law enforcement
*No possession of pornography
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety
Bond to be applied.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Defendant Michael K Traxler in court with attorney Michele Tjader.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 2.  State will move to dismiss and read-in Ct 1.  A PSI will be requested.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 2.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  Court questions Atty Tjader.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 2.  Count 1 is ordered dismissed and read-in.
**Court orders a PSI.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Michael K Traxler in court with attorney Michele Tjader appearing by telephone.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Tjader asks that the matter be set or trial.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date on March 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.    Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.
  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney Tjader request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Atty Tjader asks for a return date to be set.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.

Defendant Michael K Traxler in court with attorney Michele Tjader.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Tjader the defendant will be waiving the Preliminary Hearing today.  Atty Tjader agrees with the waiver.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

  Return date scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

with conditions:
No contact with the victims in the matter 
No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18

Defendant Michael K Traxler in court with attorney Michele Tjader.  Defendant Michael K Traxler in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Hendee requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions:  
No contact with the victims in the matter and No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18
Atty Tjader states that the defendant is in custody on his revocation of probation.  Atty Tjader requests a signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $2,500 cash bond with conditions:
No contact with the victims in the matter
No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18


Court questions counsel as to the Prelim.  Atty Tjader waives the time limits for the Prelim.  Atty Tjader has identified with the defendant the victims and he knows who they are.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.
Set for Prelim
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
